alert.note: Alert for Rabun; Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 03 at 7:04AM EDT until September 03 at 10:15AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Rabun County in northeastern Georgia... Stephens County in northeastern Georgia... Southwestern Oconee County in upstate South Carolina... * Until 1015 AM EDT. * At 704 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Enhanced stream rises area ongoing across western Oconee County in South Carolina and eastern Stephens and Rabun counties in northeast Georgia. Tributaries and streams will be threatening to cross roadways such as Gryer Branch affecting Cleveland Pike Road, and Toxaway Creek flooding North Horseshoe Bridge Road. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Toccoa, Martin, Avalon, Tallulah Falls, Tallulah Gorge State Park, Lake Hartwell, Long Creek, Eastanolee and Boydville. This includes the following streams and drainages... Station Creek, East Longnose Creek, Stekoa Creek, Brasstown Creek, East Village Creek, trib to Tugaloo River, Lake Hartwell, Tugaloo River, Long creek, Tugaloo river, Little Toccoa Creek, Bone Camp Creek, Mag Creek, Trib to Tugaloo River, trib toTugaloo River, Bear Creek, North Fork Broad River, Panther Creek, Toccoa Reservoir, Whet Stone Creek, Little Brasstown Creek, Toms Creek, Savannah River, Leatherwood Creek, Longnose Creek, Davis Creek, Spider Valley Creek, trib to Chattooga River, Cedar Creek, Eastanollee Creek, Lick Log Creek, Little Eastanollee Creek, Cane Creek, Gum Log Creek, Freeman Creek, Mill Creek, East Toxaway Creek, Toccoa creek, White Fork, Little Longnose creek, Chattooga River, Coneross Creek, Toxaway Creek, Rock Creek, Little Toxaway Creek, Clarks Creek, Chauga River, Cliff Creek and Rocky Fork. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
